pt: {sc}vain{/sc} {sc}nugatory{/sc} {sc}otiose{/sc} {sc}idle{/sc} {sc}empty{/sc} {sc}hollow{/sc} mean being without worth or significance. {sc}vain{/sc} implies either absolute or relative absence of value.
{sc}otiose{/sc} suggests that something serves no purpose and is either an encumbrance or a superfluity.

pt.t: a film without a single {it}otiose{/it} scene

pt: {sc}idle{/sc} suggests being incapable of worthwhile use or effect.
{sc}empty{/sc} and {sc}hollow{/sc} suggest a deceiving lack of real substance or soundness or genuineness.

{sc}inactive{/sc} {sc}idle{/sc} {sc}inert{/sc} {sc}passive{/sc} {sc}supine{/sc} mean not engaged in work or activity. {sc}inactive{/sc} applies to anyone or anything not in action or in operation or at work.
{sc}idle{/sc} applies to persons that are not busy or occupied or to their powers or their implements.
{sc}inert{/sc} as applied to things implies powerlessness to move or to affect other things; as applied to persons it suggests an inherent or habitual indisposition to activity.
{sc}passive{/sc} implies immobility or lack of normally expected response to an external force or influence and often suggests deliberate submissiveness or self-control.
{sc}supine{/sc} applies only to persons and commonly implies abjectness or indolence.

pt.t: a {it}supine{/it} willingness to play the fool
